text: Pump type (storm, sanitary, effluent), GPM/head rating, and NEMA enclosure rating match mechanical schedule
Submittals stamped and reviewed, including pump curves, float logic, and control panels
Pit sizing and sump depth coordinated with civil and architectural elevations
Sump pit installed plumb and level, sealed, and protected against groundwater infiltration
Concrete base installed under basin and slope provided to suction inlet
Pump(s) secured and isolated from vibration; rails and removal guides in place for duplex systems
Discharge piping installed with unions, check valves, and isolation valves
Float switches, ultrasonic sensors, or pressure transducers mounted per manufacturer instructions
Backflow prevention (if discharging to storm main) confirmed
Control panel installed and labeled; breaker rating and disconnect verified
Float levels set to activate lead/lag pumps and alarm under high-level condition
High water alarm with light and buzzer tested
Wet test performed: simulate high water levels and verify pump sequence
Flow rate and discharge confirmed (if testable)
Pump startup log recorded, and manufacturer startup forms completed
Final inspection passed by AHJ or mechanical engineer
